instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Audio board and flex had liquid damage and MacBook wont turn on. Flex and board replaced and boot but there is no audio.
Tested with three audio boards and flexes.

There is in setting output device.
When press vol up/down I see it on screen.
Mic works fine.
Audio works fine via hedphone jask socket.

There was short on <CAPACITOR>C6408</CAPACITOR> - replaced <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>, short is gone, issue with audio the same.

J6100 in diode mode looks good.

Tested with known good speakers as well - same issue.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Very likely T2 internal damage.
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Check voltage too and compare with working board.
Need to have audio board connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
[USER=73]@ajdoc[/USER] hi
I would like to have an update on what exactly was wrong in your case? cause I currently have an exact issue of yours.
